pros:
-Co-Workers can be so fun
-Residents keep you on your toes
-My boss was absolutely fantastic. Not at all a micromanager which actually made us work a lot more efficiently because we weren't stressed all the time. Trusted us to do our jobs, which we did, and worked with us rather than just sitting at their desk telling everyone what to do. That manager fostered an incredibly happy environment I won't ever forget.
cons:
-The pay is pretty bad
-Some managers do quite literally no work at all and yet still somehow keep their jobs
-Residents are wrought with mental health issues that staff don't receive training on how to deal with and are faced with scary situations regularly
-There is little inconsistency between managers and directors; directors are constantly undermining the site manager's decisions on how to handle tenants so there is very little consistency in policy and expectations. As a result we got some pretty terrible tenants that we could never evict because the director was always giving in to them rather than looking at the evidence on why they should be evicted
